menu.name: António Madeira
menu.description: A white wine grown in altitude on limestone soil near the Atlantic coast, the grapes are manually harvested and vinified using traditional techniques, resulting in a complex, fresh, and mineral character.

menu.name: Fiano Gaia Orange
menu.description: A rare, small-batch, high-end natural wine made from 100% old vine Fiano grapes grown in Irpinia, Campania, and aged in chestnut barrels.

menu.name: Vulvecania Pet-Nat
menu.description: A natural wine made from Gamay farmed organically in the southern part of Beaujolais. Spontaneous fermentation and no added sulfites.

menu.name: Glou Glou
menu.description: A no added sulfites natural wine made from a blend of 63% Carignan, 23% Zinfandel, 3% Valdiguie, 8% Charbono. Most of the grapes in Glou Glou underwent carbonic maceration, the classic fermentation method of the Beaujolais, which means that fermentation happened inside of berries themselves.

menu.name: Skin Contact
menu.description: A natural wine made from a field blend of grapes farmed organically in Contra Costa County, California. Spontaneous fermentation with native yeast, unfined, unfiltered, no added sulfites.

menu.name: Rosé of Pinot Gris
menu.description: A rosé natural wine made from 100% Pinot Gris grapes grown with one day of skin contact, aged in neutral oak and bottled unfined.
